definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Ice caves are very different from normal caves.
sentences.chinese: 冰洞窟與普通的洞窟有着天壤之別。

sentences.english: Ice caves are very different from normal caves.
sentences.chinese: 冰洞窟與普通的洞窟有着天壤之別。

sentences.english: In 2009, a team of British cavers investigated a recently uncovered cave in a remote Vietnamese jungle.
sentences.chinese: 年，一羣英國洞窟專家到越南中部森林深處探險。

sentences.english: The main formation that causes water percolation into the cave is the unloading joint and the trivial cracks by weathering.
sentences.chinese: 造成洞窟滲漏水的主要構造是卸荷節理和風化微裂縫。

sentences.english: In some grottoes, there are as many as three mural layers.
sentences.chinese: 有些洞窟中，壁畫疊壓達三層之多。

sentences.english: The cave by artificial chiseled into, for the Yuan Dynasty chisel.
sentences.chinese: 洞窟由人工鑿成，爲元代所鑿。

sentences.english: If no remedial measures are taken, the upper layer grottoes are bound to become open-air.
sentences.chinese: 如不加強治理，上層洞窟終將變成露天。

sentences.english: This grotto is called “Coral” and it is not difficult to guess why.
sentences.chinese: 這個洞窟叫“珊瑚”，不難想象爲什麼要如此稱之。

sentences.english: Then reached the caverns measureless to man.
sentences.chinese: 於是到達了不可測的洞窟。

sentences.english: In Bethlehem the sacred area around the Nativity Grotto has been the focal point of all tradition.
sentences.chinese: 在白冷聖誕洞窟周圍聚焦了所有傳統。

sentences.english: From the remnants of the six caves, cave-rectangular top coupons .
sentences.chinese: 從殘存的六個洞窟看，洞窟券頂式長方形。

sentences.english: From the remnants of the six caves, cave-rectangular top coupons .
sentences.chinese: 從殘存的六個洞窟看，洞窟券頂式長方形。

sentences.english: Only success in controlling the water can deliver the caves from danger.
sentences.chinese: 只有治水的成功，才能使洞窟脫離險境。

sentences.english: Fears we have hidden in. Like this wretched caves.
sentences.chinese: 也和冷冽洞窟一般，深藏於內心的恐懼一起死去。

sentences.english: I tried to love this loneliness to slip out of this lonesome hole.
sentences.chinese: 我嘗試愛上這份孤獨，跳出這個寂寞的洞窟。

sentences.english: There we found a cavern which was large enough for two rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我們在那裏發現了一個有兩間房大的洞窟。

definition: rock cave/grotto/cliff caves (often with Buddhist statues)
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
Dongkou county in Shaoyang 邵陽|邵阳[Shao4 yang2], Hunan
a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
